story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Nigeria, there was a kind and curious little girl named Ada. Ada loved to explore the world around her and ask questions about everything she saw. She was especially fascinated by the animals that lived in the forest near her home.

One day, Ada decided to go on a journey to find the rarest and most beautiful animal in the forest. She packed a bag with a water bottle, some snacks, and a notebook to record her findings. She said goodbye to her family and set off on her adventure.

As she walked deeper into the forest, Ada encountered many different animals. She saw monkeys swinging from tree to tree, and colorful birds singing sweet songs. She even saw a family of elephants drinking from a nearby river. But Ada was determined to find the rarest animal of them all.

After many hours of searching, Ada finally came across a small clearing in the forest. And there, in the middle of the clearing, was the most beautiful animal she had ever seen. It was a small, furry creature with big, round eyes and a long, bushy tail. Ada had never seen anything like it before.

She slowly approached the animal, taking care not to scare it away. As she got closer, the animal looked up at her and blinked its big, round eyes. Ada felt a sudden connection to the creature, and she knew that she had found the rarest and most beautiful animal in the forest.

But as she reached out her hand to touch the animal, it suddenly disappeared into thin air! Ada was shocked and confused. She looked around the clearing, but the animal was nowhere to be found.

Suddenly, Ada heard a voice speaking to her. "Thank you for finding me, Ada," the voice said. "I am the rarest and most beautiful animal in the forest, but I can only be seen by those who truly appreciate my beauty."

Ada was amazed. She had finally found the rarest animal in the forest, and it had spoken to her! She asked the animal if she could see it again, but the voice told her that it could only appear to her once.

Ada thanked the animal for showing itself to her, and she promised to always appreciate the beauty of the world around her. She said goodbye to the animal and made her way back home, with a newfound appreciation for the wonders of the natural world.

From that day on, Ada continued to explore the world around her and ask questions about everything she saw. But she never forgot the rare and beautiful animal that she had encountered in the forest, and she always remembered to appreciate the beauty of the world around her.

And with that, my dear daughter, it is time for you to close your eyes and dream of your own adventures in the world. Goodnight!
